A Song of degrees. In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he heard me.
Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, <FI>and<Fi> from a deceitful tongue.

What shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee, thou false tongue?<RF>What shall be given…: or, What shall the deceitful tongue give unto thee? or, what shall is profit thee?<Rf><RF>done: Heb. added<Rf>
Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.<RF>Sharp…: or, It is as the sharp arrows of the mighty man, with coals of juniper<Rf><CM>
Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, <FI>that<Fi> I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.
I <FI>am for<Fi> peace: but when I speak, they <FI>are<Fi> for war.<RF>for peace: or, a man of peace<Rf><CM>
